nodes.label: modular design
nodes.additionalInformation: Modularity, i.e. the distribution of sub-functions of the product among distinct functional carriers with clearly defined interfaces, can help achieving a clear separation of vitamins and DIY parts.
nodes.example: De-couple energy source and usage, so that any type of source can be used (e.g. electric motor, hydraulic pressure) for generating a given movement.

nodes.label: Standard tools
nodes.description: Opt for processes that can be performed with standard tools
nodes.additionalInformation: The more widely available the required tools are, the more probable it is that it will be accessible to anyone.

nodes.label: Commonplace materials
nodes.additionalInformation: The more widely available the required materials are, the more probable it is that they can be purchased by anyone.
nodes.example: Wood plate in sizes available in hardware stores.

nodes.label: Discarded materials
nodes.description: Use discarded materials and materials that are to-hand
nodes.additionalInformation: Designing a product made of discarded materials that can be commonly used in households may be a solution for facilitating purchase. It should be however considered that discarded materials may have lower accuracy and require pre-processing steps.

nodes.label: Standard components
nodes.description: Use general purpose and standard components
nodes.additionalInformation: Standard components may be more easily available than exotic ones. Using them may therefore ease the purchasing process.
nodes.example: Widely available standards nuts and bolts that can be found in hardware stores.

nodes.label: Room for tailoring
nodes.additionalInformation: A motivation for making a product in a DIY setting is the possibility to get a tailored product. Flexibility can be built in the product design in order to ease the tailoring process.
nodes.example: Parameterized design of a bicycle frame.

nodes.label: Flexible construction
nodes.additionalInformation: Giving a scope for last-minute tweaking in case the design cannot exactly be realized as described in the product requirements would allow overcoming shortages in the production process.
nodes.example: High geometric and material tolerances, beams with equally separated attachment holes.

nodes.label: Reversible joinings
nodes.description: Prefer reversible to permanent joining features
nodes.additionalInformation: Using removable and adjustable joining features allows accommodating mistakes or correcting misalignments in the assembly process.
nodes.example: Interlocking elements or nuts and bolts vs. welding.

nodes.label: Vitamin variation
nodes.additionalInformation: If several vitamins are required, it may be useful to use the same vitamin each time needed in order to reduce the purchase and storage effort.
nodes.example: One type of bolt for the assembly of all parts of the product, one type of step motors for translating the plateau of a machine-tool in all three directions or space.

nodes.label: Raw material variation
nodes.additionalInformation: Strive designing all DIY-components so they can be made out of the same material and using same processes. This would allow reducing the purchasing effort and the requirements for processing tools.
nodes.example: 3D design made of assembled laser-cut plywood.

nodes.label: Symmetries
nodes.additionalInformation: Using symmetries is another way of reducing part variation, to use several times the same part and to profit from learning curve in the production.

nodes.label: Stackability
nodes.additionalInformation: Building a product of a large size/power may be more difficult than building numbers of small products that can be combined in order to reach the desired size/power. It reduces the risk and need of handling larger and heavy products.
nodes.example: A high luminous emittance can be reached by combining several LED.

nodes.label: Ease of handling
nodes.description: Ensure ease of handling and transportation
nodes.additionalInformation: Bulky or fragile products may be difficult to handle and may require specific handling or holding mechanisms. In those case, use built-in handling mechanisms or provide DIY handling tools.
nodes.example: Wheels and contact points built in the frame of the product, DIY building jig

nodes.label: DIY options
nodes.additionalInformation: Not everybody have the same skills, tools, and interest in building things. It may be interesting giving the maker the possibility to choose by itself, which of the parts he or she consider as a vitamin.

nodes.label: Simple solutions
nodes.additionalInformation: The simpler the design the more probable it is someone will have the required tools and skills to build it. Because there is no universal definition for simplicity, you may offer different alternatives for each function.

nodes.label: Material availability
nodes.description: Use materials that can be easily procured

nodes.label: Reduced BOM
nodes.description: Reduce the number of different parts to be produced

nodes.label: Flexible design
nodes.description: Use flexible design so the product can be adapted to the production environment
